content.description:
“Our detached and distant situation invites and enables us to pursue a different course. . . .
“Why forgo the advantages of so peculiar a situation? Why quit our own to stand upon foreign ground? Why, by interweaving our destiny with that of any part of Europe, entangle our peace and prosperity in the toils of European ambition, rivalship, interest, humor, or caprice?
“It is our true policy to steer clear of permanent alliances with any portion of the foreign world.”
President George Washington, Farewell Address, 1796
content.question: During his administration, Washington pursued the foreign policy suggested by the excerpt in part because he believed that the

choices.label: new nation needed time to gain economic and military strength
Constitution prohibited the United States from making treaties
United States should not acquire new territory by force
United States should establish alliances with both France and Britain

content.answer: new nation needed time to gain economic and military strength
